author: Passant Rabie
title: A Solar System Internet? Space Laser Test Moves Us Closer
description: The deep-space optical communication link could revolutionize how scientists communicate with spacecraft as they explore the solar system.
content: Scientists at the European Space Agency used a laser to communicate with a spacecraft 165 million miles (265 million kilometers) away in deep space for the first time, marking a major step forward in… [+3533 chars]

author: Ellyn Lapointe
title: Deflecting a Killer Asteroid Is More Complicated Than NASA Thought
description: Scientists still have much to learn about the potentially life-saving "kinetic impactor technique."
content: In 2022, NASA rammed a spacecraft into an asteroid to see if it could alter its orbital period around its parent asteroid. The mission, dubbed the Double Asteroid Redirection Test (DART), aimed to de… [+5346 chars]

author: Margherita Bassi
title: Why Ancient Egypt Smashed Hatshepsut’s Statues After Her Death
description: Scholars have long believed that Hatshepsut’s spiteful predecessor wanted to destroy every image of her, but the truth may be more nuanced.
content: Hatshepsut is one of the most famous figures in ancient Egypt. In 1479 BCE, she took on the role of regent on behalf of her young nephew Thutmose III. By 1473, she began ruling as a pharaoh in her ow… [+3649 chars]

description: Vitamin C may make skin look younger and tackle signs of aging, new research finds. Here, experts explain how it works and how to reap the vitamin’s benefits...
